instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes no video
threads.message:
Hey,

I have this board that had liquid damage around ISL area and wasnt turning on. Also some damage around <CAPACITOR>C7555</CAPACITOR>, <CHIP>U9500</CHIP> and burnt BKL pins on LCD connector. Replaced ISL, <CAPACITOR>C7555</CAPACITOR> area, LCD connector and cleaned up <CHIP>U9500</CHIP> area. Now it turns on and chimes, but no video. Using known good LCD and cable. External video is working.

pn 2&3 of J900 - 0V /Diode - .445
pn 4 - 3.3V


U900
PIN 2&3 - 3.3V
PIN 1- .012 V / Diode - . 410

Thanks. Have a good one!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes no video
threads.message:
Diode mode on all pins from LVDS connector...

Also do a continuity test from connector to the other end of LVDS cable....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes no video
threads.message: No video and no BKL? Probably bad soldering on the connector or connector got fucked.
